definition[0]: to secretly damage or destroy equipment, vehicles etc that belong to an enemy or opponent, so that they cannot be used
example[0]: Every single plane had been sabotaged.
definition[1]: to deliberately spoil someone’s plans because you do not want them to succeed
definition[2]: deliberate damage that is done to equipment, vehicles etc in order to prevent an enemy or opponent from using them
example[2]: The terrorists were planning acts of sabotage to destabilize the country.
example[4]: There are fears that striking workers may try to sabotage the plant.
example[5]: He’s trying to sabotage my career.
example[6]: Why would anyone want to sabotage the deal?
